articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. manufacturing remained subdued in November, according to a survey on Friday that also showed factory employment declining.
articles.title: US manufacturing stays depressed in November-ISM

articles.author: Samrhitha A, Chavi Mehta
articles.description: Tesla shares (TSLA.O) fell more than 3% on Friday after the highly anticipated launch of its Cybertruck left analysts concerned about the electric vehicle's steep price tag and a longer wait for significant financial payoff.
articles.title: Tesla falls on long wait for Cybertruck payoff, hefty price tag

articles.author: Deborah Sophia, Aishwarya Venugopal
articles.description: Retailers like Amazon.com and Foot Locker are signaling optimism for holiday season sales after stronger-than-expected figures during Black Friday and Cyber Monday, as heavy discounts lured budget-strained customers on the peak U.S. shopping days.
articles.title: Once-gloomy US retailers now signaling more holiday cheer after solid start to season

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Some major banks expect global economic growth to ease further in 2024, squeezed by elevated interest rates, higher energy prices and a slowdown in the world's two largest economies.
articles.title: Global economy to slow down but likely avoid recession in 2024

articles.author: David Shepardson, David Lawder
articles.description: The Biden administration on Friday issued-long awaited guidance that will limit Chinese content in batteries eligible for electric vehicle tax credits starting next year.
articles.title: US to limit Chinese firms, battery parts from winning EV tax credits

articles.author: Mayela Armas
articles.description: Some retailers in Venezuela are turning to old-fashioned layaway purchase offers to help customers buy everything from home appliances to shoes and motorcycles, as sky-high inflation and tight credit restrictions cut off other avenues for shopping.
articles.title: Tight credit, high inflation push Venezuelans to layaway purchases

articles.author: Sheila Dang, Chavi Mehta, Jaspreet Singh
articles.description: Social media company X faces the prospect of more advertisers fleeing and has no clear fix in sight, ad industry experts said, after billionaire owner Elon Musk lashed out at some of the biggest brands for dropping the platform.
articles.title: After Musk tirade, X faces prospect of more advertisers fleeing

articles.author: Chad Terhune, Robin Respaut
articles.description: Drugmaker Novo Nordisk paid U.S. medical professionals at least $25.8 million over a decade in fees and expenses related to its weight-loss drugs, a Reuters analysis found. It concentrated that money on an elite group of obesity specialists who advocate giving its powerful and expensive drugs to tens of millions of Americans.
articles.title: Maker of Wegovy, Ozempic showers money on U.S. obesity doctors

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: Israel's military said it intercepted a rocket fired from Gaza early on Friday while Hamas-affiliated media reported sounds of gunfire and explosions in the north of the coastal strip shortly before a deadline to extend a seven-day truce was set to expire.
articles.title: Israel intercepts rocket as gunfire, explosions in north Gaza reported

articles.author: Shristi A, Amruta Khandekar
articles.description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq fell on Friday as investors were on edge ahead of Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's comments that some fear may have a hawkish tilt towards monetary policy.
articles.title: S&P, Nasdaq slip as caution prevails ahead of Powell comments
